report.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a written or spoken description of a situation or event, giving people the information they need
report.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Colleges have to provide a written report on the progress of each student during the year.
report.translation[0].definitions[1].def: a piece of writing in a newspaper about something that is happening, or part of a news programme
report.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: According to recent news reports, two of the victims are Americans.
media reports of the food shortages
report.translation[0].definitions[2].def: an official document that carefully considers a particular subject
report.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: a recent report on child abuse
report.translation[0].definitions[3].def: information that something has happened, which may or may not be true
report.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: Police received reports of a bomb threat at the airport at 11:28 p.m.

a report that he had been killed
report.translation[0].definitions[4].def: a written statement by teachers about a child’s work at school, which is sent to his or her parents
report.translation[0].definitions[5].def: someone who works for a particular manager

report.translation[1].definitions[1].def: to tell someone about what has been happening, or what you are doing as part of your job
report.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: I’ve asked him to come back next week and report on his progress.
report.translation[1].definitions[2].def: to officially give information to the public
report.translation[1].definitions[2].exa: Doctors have reported a 13% increase in the number of people with heart disease.

report.translation[1].definitions[5].def: to go somewhere and officially state that you have arrived
